definition: wherever one goes
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: Everywhere they appeared they were ovations.
sentences.chinese: 他们所到之处都有人欢呼。

sentences.english: He went to strike at the hedge, but where his sword met the thorns, great roses bloomed instead.
sentences.chinese: 他开始披荆斩棘，但是他宝剑所到之处都开出了蔷薇。

sentences.english: This footprint damages and depletes almost everything in its path.
sentences.chinese: 这些足迹所到之处破坏并耗尽了几乎一切资源。

sentences.english: Wherever he went, the wound soldier left behind him a trail of blood.
sentences.chinese: 伤员所到之处，都留下道道血迹。

sentences.english: They went to meet prime minister Jospin.
sentences.chinese: 所到之处，以满足总理若斯潘。

sentences.english: Everywhere are the collapsed buildings, such as death or injury to life, a bleak.
sentences.chinese: 所到之处，都是残垣断壁如死伤的生命，一片凄凉。

sentences.english: The hurricane flattered crops, uprooted trees, washed away roads and rippled off roofs.
sentences.chinese: 飓风所到之处，庄稼倒伏，树根拔起，房顶掀飞。

sentences.english: Everywhere you turn, people are talking about trends. On a CNN news show, a Chyron runs in the corner of the screen pointing out stories that are "trending now."
sentences.chinese: 你所到之处，人们都在谈论潮流。

sentences.english: It will give you a whole new perspective on the place you are visiting.
sentences.chinese: 这将给你一个全新的视角来观察你们所到之处。

sentences.english: Wherever we looked, we saw evidence of destruction.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目光所到之处，都是毁坏的迹象。

sentences.english: The leaves rustled where Tim had disappeared into the underbrush.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆消失在灌木从里，他所到之处树叶沙沙作响。

sentences.english: Everywhere he went, audiences reacted with almost delirious delight.
sentences.chinese: 他所到之处，听众无不欢欣若狂。

sentences.english: He leads an army so massive it shakes the ground with its march.
sentences.chinese: 他率领的部队是如此豪壮，所到之处地动山摇。

definition: in an instant
to disperse/to scatter in all directions
in all directions/all around/far and near
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
instantly/in no time
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to be swept by the wind/to be blown about by the wind/to be routed (in battle etc)
in a split second
everything
to flock (to see)/to mill/to throng
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
to spring up everywhere/from all around
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
lit. not even a blade of grass grows (idiom)/fig. barren
defeated/routed
